required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of Inhaled Montelukast (MK-0476) in Participants With Mild or Moderate Asthma (MK-0476-380 AM3)(COMPLETED)
clinical_study.official_title: A Sequential, 3-Part, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Single-Rising-Dose and Rising-Multiple-Dose Study in Healthy Subjects and Mild or Moderate Asthmatic Patients to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of Inhaled MK-0476

brief_summary.textblock: A study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of inhaled Montelukast (MK-0476) in participants with mild or moderate asthma.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced At Least One Adverse Event
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 14 days after last dose of study drug

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Discontinued Study Drug Due to an Adverse Event
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 days after last dose of study drug

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From 0 to 24 Hours (AUC 0-24hr) of Montelukast - Single Dose
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples for assessment of AUC 0-24hr were drawn predose and then at specified timepoints (up to 24 hours postdose) on Day 1 in Part I.
Blood samples for assessment of AUC 0-24hr were drawn predose and then at specified timepoints (up to 24 hours postdose) on Days 1 and 5 in Part II and on Days 1 and 10 in Part III.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Montelukast - Single Dose
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples for assessment of Cmax were drawn predose and then at specified timepoints (up to 24 hours postdose) on Day 1 in Part I.
Blood samples for assessment of Cmax were drawn predose and then at specified timepoints (up to 24 hours postdose) on Days 1 and 5 in Part II and on Days 1 and 10 in Part III.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Cmax (Tmax) of Montelukast - Single Dose
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples for assessment of Tmax were drawn predose and then at specified timepoints (up to 24 hours postdose) on Day 1 in Part I.
Blood samples for assessment of Tmax were drawn predose and then at specified timepoints (up to 24 hours postdose) on Days 1 and 5 in Part II and on Days 1 and 10 in Part III.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Terminal Half Life (t1/2) of Montelukast - Single Dose
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples for assessment of t1/2 were drawn predose and then at specified timepoints (up to 24 hours postdose) on Day 1 in Part I.
Blood samples for assessment of t1/2 were drawn predose and then at specified timepoints (up to 24 hours postdose) on Days 1 and 5 in Part II and on Days 1 and 10 in Part III.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC 0-24hr Accumulation Ratio of Montelukast - Multiple Doses
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 days after first dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: The AUC 0-24hr Accumulation Ratio of Montelukast was calculated as the geometric mean ratio of AUC 0-24hr on the last day and the first day of a multiple dose regimen: Day 5/Day 1 in Part II and Day 10/Day 1 in Part III.

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax Accumulation Ratio of Montelukast - Multiple Doses
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 days after first dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: The Cmax Accumulation Ratio of Montelukast was calculated as the geometric mean ratio of Cmax on the last day and the first day of a multiple dose regimen: Day 5/Day 1 in Part II and Day 10/Day 1 in Part III.

arm_group.description: Participants receive Montelukast inhalation powder, 0.1 mg. Part I: Administered as a single dose followed by at least a 3-day washout period.
Participants receive Montelukast inhalation powder, 0.3 mg. Part I: Administered as a single dose followed by at least a 3-day washout period.

Participants receive Montelukast inhalation powder, 1 mg. Part I: Administered as a single dose followed by at least a 3-day washout period. Part II: Administered once daily (QD) for 5 days followed by at least a 3-day washout period.

Participants receive Montelukast inhalation powder, 3 mg. Part I: Administered as a single dose followed by at least a 3-day washout period. Part II: Administered QD for 5 days followed by at least a 3-day washout period. Part III: Administered QD for 10 days followed by at least a 7-day washout period.

Participants receive Montelukast inhalation powder, 10 mg. Part I: Administered as a single dose followed by at least a 3-day washout period. Part II: Administered QD for 5 days followed by at least a 3-day washout period. Part III: Administered QD for 10 days followed by at least a 7-day washout period.

Participants receive Placebo to Montelukast inhalation powder. Part I: Administered as a single dose followed by at least a 3-day washout period. Part II: Administered QD for 5 days followed by at least a 3-day washout period. Part III: Administered QD for 10 days followed by at least a 7-day washout period.

intervention.description: Montelukast dry powder inhaler, 0.1 mg, 0.3 mg, 1 mg, 3 mg or 10 mg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female between the ages of 18 and 65
- Must have mild or moderate asthma (Part III only)
- Nonsmoker for at least 6 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of stroke, chronic seizures or major neurological disorder
- You are nursing
- Drink more than 3 glasses of alcohol a day
- Have allergy to or not able to tolerate lactose
- Have a history of drug abuse in the last 5 years
- Drink more than 6 beverages containing caffeine a day
- Have had surgery, donated blood or participated in another investigational study in the last 4 weeks

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from 3 study sites located in the United States.

group.title: Part I - Montelukast
group.description: Part I consisted of 6 periods. Participants were to receive single doses of inhaled Montelukast (0.1 mg, 0.3 mg, 0.3 mg repeat, 1 mg, 3 mg or 10 mg). Each dose was separated by at least a 3-day washout period.

group.title: Part I - Montelukast and Placebo
group.description: Part I consisted of 6 periods. Participants were to receive single doses of inhaled Montelukast (0.1 mg, 0.3 mg, 0.3 mg repeat, 1 mg, 3 mg or 10 mg) or Placebo. Each dose was separated by at least a 3-day washout period.

group.title: Part II - Montelukast
group.description: Part II consisted of 3 periods. Participants in three serial panels (Panels A, B and C) were to receive once daily (QD) doses of inhaled Montelukast (1 mg, 3 mg or 10 mg) administered for 5 consecutive days. Each panel was separated by at least a 3-day washout period.

group.title: Part II - Placebo
group.description: Part II consisted of 3 periods. Participants in three serial panels (Panels A, B and C) were to receive QD doses of inhaled Placebo administered for 5 consecutive days. Each panel was separated by at least a 3-day washout period.

group.title: Part III - Montelukast
group.description: Part III consisted of 2 periods. Participants in two serial panels (Panels A and B) were to receive QD doses of inhaled Montelukast (3 mg or 10 mg) administered for 10 consecutive days. Each panel was separated by at least a 7-day washout period.

group.title: Part III - Montelukast and Placebo
group.description: Part III consisted of 2 periods. Participants in two serial panels (Panels A and B) were to receive QD doses of inhaled Montelukast (3 mg or 10 mg) or Placebo administered for 10 consecutive days. Each panel was separated by at least a 7-day washout period.

group.title: Part III - Placebo
group.description: Part III consisted of 2 periods. Participants in two serial panels (Panels A and B) were to receive QD doses of inhaled or Placebo administered for 10 consecutive days. Each panel was separated by at least a 7-day washout period.

participants_list.participants: One participant discontinued after completing Period 2. Doses in Periods 1 and 2 were Montelukast.
One participant withdrew consent after completing all study doses.
One participant withdrew consent after completing all study doses.

group.title: Part I
group.description: Part I consisted of 6 periods. Participants were to receive single doses of inhaled Montelukast (0.1 mg, 0.3 mg, 0.3 repeat, 1 mg, 3 mg or 10 mg) or Placebo. Each dose was separated by at least a 3-day washout period.

group.title: Part II
group.description: Part II consisted of 3 periods. Participants in three serial panels (Panels A, B and C) were to receive once daily (QD) doses of inhaled Montelukast (1 mg, 3 mg or 10 mg) or Placebo administered for 5 consecutive days. Each panel was separated by at least a 3-day washout period.

group.title: Part III
group.description: Part III consisted of 2 periods. Participants in two serial panels (Panels A and B) were to receive QD doses of inhaled Montelukast (3 mg or 10 mg) or Placebo administered for 10 consecutive days. Each panel was separated by at least a 7-day washout period.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the SPONSOR as confidential must be deleted prior to submission.
